title: Distributive Property
text: The first step is to use the distributive property. $$\left(x+4\right) \left(3x-2y+5\right)$$ $$=$$ $$x\left(3x-2y+5\right)+4\left(3x-2y+5\right)$$

title: Multiply
text: The next step is to multiply those terms. $$x\left(3x-2y+5\right)+4\left(3x-2y+5\right)$$ $$=$$ $$3x^2-2xy+5x+12x-8y+20$$

title: Combining Like Terms
text: After you multiply, in order to simplify, you need to combine like terms. $$3x^2-2xy+5x+12x-8y+20$$ $$=$$ $$3x^2-2xy+5x+12x-8y+20$$
